page.title: 16 THE ADDER PATCH
page.content:
Two hundred metres west of the village of Ramsden Heath is the adder patch.There are only a few adders left there now. It takes about an hour to get to the adder patch because there are two bogs in the way. When you do reach there the effort has been worth while because the adder patch is used as a scramble course.Perhaps this is why there are not many adders there now. There are hills and jumps,bumps and lumps.Horses go there as well, so we have to be careful. We go on our motor bikes and it is really good fun. Dean Knieriem has a Yamaha eighty. Stephen Mason has a Yamaha fifty.
Written by Stephen Mason and Dean Knieriem.
